Alihendraï¼šâ€œYou one of those heroes, an't you?â€
Soldier76ï¼šâ€œNot anymore.â€

I started playing OverWatch in October 2016, which has been my favorite FPS games for six years. Later, OverWatch 2 appeared. When I saw the promotional video of OverWatch 2, I cried, it's not an exaggeration. The touch that OverWatch brought me was real, and I still remember Winston's inspiring speech to the players; I still remember the love and hate between Genji and the Hanzo brothers; I still remember the strong Mei who fought for her deceased companions; I still remember the deep friendship between the Bastion and Nini ï¼ŒRoadhog and Junkrat two carzy, the sexy and charming Widowmaker, Mercy saves people from dangers, the fearless Reinharot, and the Hongyu of the Lijiang Tower, as well as the friends I used to play with, whenever I saw and heard the two words "OverWatch", these memories flashed in my mind one by one. Until OverWatch 2 was launched, everything was over. They were all my heroes. But you, Blizzard, you personally destroyed them,You have betrayed the trust of the players. OverWatch used to be an excellent game, but it shouldn't be like this now, just staring at the balance in the player's wallet, making you want to say â€œNO! F___ You!â€to it.You guys are so f___ing disappointing.

OHHHHH  BEST GAME!!!! 
I love you, just like you love me
â™¡ â¥  â™¥  â£

TLDR: The company does not value you as a player and the game does not value any of your time. We live in a world where games provide incentives to spend time on a game, providing events, content and rewards that are obtainable. Overwatch2 does everything in its power to oppose that by making the player basically pay for everything within the game. This game is not worth pursuing anymore unfortunately, nor is it worth supporting them in any way shape or form. It is truly a disappointment as the game itself had insane potential and yet they basically threw it all in the trash and set it on fire.

I used to love this game. Overwatch 1 was one of the best multiplayer experiences I had playing a game of it's kind (basically a shooter but with Heroes rather than weapons that change around, each with their unique ability).
Despite its faults, it was still a great game and I had accrued about 800 hours before OW2 released.

Now the problem comes from how HORRIBLE the "Sequel" was handled. The players were lied to over and over and over again about so many things, but nothing was as bad as the fact that the MAIN POINT OF CREATING A SEQUEL, literally the main reason they allegedly decided to create a sequel, was cancelled. Sure you might get some bits and pieces, but that was already part of the first game (as part of an event called Archives. AND IT WAS FREE).

This gameplay now remains enjoyable, however, due to all the money grabbing, the terrible choices and many other concerns (such as re-releasing old functionalities (that were removed for no reason) and pretending it's new; or the matchmaking which has never been more broken, an excessive majority of the matches you'll play will be complete stomps (where one team absolutely destroys the other, making it unenjoyable)) makes this a game that in my opinion should be avoided.

Just as an idea skins that before used to be obtainable by either lootboxes (either paid or obtained (you were able to actually obtain a lot of stuff previous in OW1))... now on average cost 20 dollars/euros/pounds, which is absolutely ridiculous. The battle pass does not offer premium currency. And if I recall correctly one needs to do all the weekly/daily? missions for almost a year to be able to purchase 1 single skin.

Companies should suffer from terrible choices and should learn that gameplay and quality is important and should not be abandoned (at least not to the level they did), which is why I highly advise against playing it no matter how fun the gameplay may appear. The longer companies get away with stuff like this the worse it's going to get, up to a point there will be no going back.
What can you expect from a small indie company that obviously needs funds (and talent).

[h1] Misleading title and advertising [/h1]

the only reason this title exists it to monetize overwatch without blizzard getting into legal trouble

i'd say the mainline feature of this game is FOMO, the game has battle passes now and the rewards are much like this game, a steaming pile of shit, and even if you complete the pass you won't get enough premium currency back from it to get the next upcoming pass, smart move by blizzard, you'll always feel the need to spend money

the free currency you could get from role queue from the first game is also behind the battle pass now,
pve is somewhat here but it's behind time limited events

the only upside of this game is the change from 6v6 to 5v5, meaning the chances of getting a seizure induced coma from all the effects on your screen are somewhat reduced

due to the game's f2p nature you can't really expect anything else other than new skins being introduced, and in that aspect the only ones really winning here are coomers, cause the porn can let you enjoy them for free and on other perspectives other than first person

Bought the game on release and actually enjoyed it. Took a break for a year and came back, enjoyed it some more. OVERWATCH 2 GUYS!!!!! this is where I started hating the game. It's apperant its a giant cash grab. Can't wait to see TF2 outlive this used to be beloved game again. 3rd time champs!
